timeline.message: Replace deprecated Commons CLI PosixParser and OptionBuilder.
Replace deprecated Xerces XML serializer with one from org.w3c.dom.
Remove deprecated getMetadata(Context, String) from CommunityService, CollectionService.

Better fix for configuration issue in c463b632dd24e0c017d88b36b2b6fa0f13d95fb1

Other code now depends on the 'id' of the curation script configuration bean,
so it can't be renamed.  Instead, remove the bean post processing code that
pokes 'dspace.cfg' properties into a bean which are prefixed with the bean's
'id', since nobody can remember why we do that and it causes subtle magical
problems.  It may be for Guice, which is no longer an option for DSpace.
I missed a lot of deprecated PosixParser and OptionBuilder in the clutter of warnings (see?).

Fix broken test by catching an unexpected exception.

There must be an unchecked exception bubbling up through SolrServiceImpl#search.  Catching Exception (as before this PR) fixes the test failure.
Replace deprecated constructors of boxed primitive types. [#2956]
Fix anything that is documented @deprecated but not annotated @Deprecated. [#2956]
Remove long-deprecated un-localized methods from LocationUtils. [#2956]

Remove deprecated setMetadata of CommunityService, CollectionService #2956

This introduces a new class:  a holder for metadata field names.
Found a few more deprecated PosixParser, GnuParser, OptionBuilder. #2956

Replace deprecated setMetadata() that uses removed field names. #2956

Once upon a time, DSOs had dedicated fields for some metadata.  These were
moved into the Metadatavalue table long ago, but there were still methods
which used the old field names instead of proper MetadataField triplets.

Replace deprecated setMetadata() that uses removed field names. #2956

Once upon a time, DSOs had dedicated fields for some metadata.  These were
moved into the Metadatavalue table long ago, but there were still methods
which used the old field names instead of proper MetadataField triplets.
Replace deprecated icu4j Normalizer with Normalizer2. #2956
Replace deprecated JUnit and Mockito statics. #2956

timeline.bodyText: I'm not a fun of "complex" initialization outside of a constructor... but it is also a class that probably should be removed / deprecated. I'm not sure that this feature still work at all
timeline.author: abollini
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -59,7 +60,9 @@
     /**
      * the output file to which to write aggregation data
      */
-    private String output = ConfigurationManager.getProperty("dspace.dir") +
+    ConfigurationService configurationService
+            = DSpaceServicesFactory.getInstance().getConfigurationService();

replies.bodyText:
I've moved the initialization inside the formerly empty constructor.
I believe that this feature is due to be removed anyway after 7.0, so it is probably not worth the effort to figure out what could be removed now.
replies.author: mwoodiupui

timeline.bodyText: the check log.isDebugEnabled() should be moved inside the logConfiguration method
timeline.author: abollini

replies.bodyText: Normally I would not use #isDebugEnabled but, since the code is iterating over a HashMap and logging its content, the added efficiency is probably worthwhile.
replies.author: mwoodiupui

timeline.bodyText: Instead of looping through all properties, this can just use configurationService.getPropertyKeys("swordv2-server.simpledc.") to find all properties starting with that prefix.  See https://github.com/DSpace/DSpace/blob/main/dspace-services/src/main/java/org/dspace/servicemanager/config/DSpaceConfigurationService.java#L135
timeline.author: tdonohue

timeline.bodyText: Same here...can use getPropertyKeys([prefix]) instead of looping through every configuration.
timeline.author: tdonohue

timeline.bodyText: I think this could be refactored to be configurationService.getPropertyKeys(authPrefix) in order to find every key that starts with authPrefix.
timeline.author: tdonohue

timeline.bodyText: Again, this looks like it could be replaced by configurationService.getPropertyKeys(CONFIG_PREFIX); and simplify the for loop after it
timeline.author: tdonohue

timeline.bodyText: Again, looks like this could be configurationService.getPropertyKeys(propname); to simplify the for loop
timeline.author: tdonohue
tdonohue

replies.bodyText: @mwoodiupui : Looks like you overlooked this one on accident.  Should be configurationService.getPropertyKeys(propname)
replies.author: tdonohue

timeline.author: tdonohue

timeline.bodyText: Again, could be configurationService.getPropertyKeys(nsPrefix); & simplify the for loop.
timeline.author: tdonohue
tdonohue

timeline.message: Address one more review comment.  New unit test class to test it.
